metadata.template_skill: Student places a 1/2-family fraction on a number line to show it lands at the same position as an equivalent fraction

telemetry_data.mastery_skill: Student can verify equivalence by placing fractions at the same point on a number line

steps.dialogue: Look at the top line. One half is marked there. Now look at the bottom line with sixths.

prompt.text: Place three sixths on the bottom line.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Count three sixths from zero and check where one half is on the top line.

Let's think about this together. We need to place three sixths on the bottom line. That means counting 3 of those sixth intervals from zero. Compare where that lands to where one half is marked on the top line - they should line up at the same position.

Let me walk you through this. First, look at where one half is marked on the top line - it's at the halfway point. Now on the bottom line, we need to count three sixths from zero. Start at zero and count: one sixth, two sixths, three sixths. Three sixths lands right here at the third tick mark from zero. Notice how that lines up exactly with one half on the top line. That's because three sixths and one half are equivalent fractions - they name the same position.

on_correct.dialogue: Right there. Three sixths lands at the same point as one half.
